issue.title: fix: [WIP] unstable term cursor identical names

labels.name: needs: reviewer response
labels.description: This needs the attention of  a codeowner or maintainer.

issue.body:
<!--

### Your checklist for this pull request
Thanks for sending a pull request! Please make sure you click the link above to view the contribution guidelines, then fill out the blanks below.

🚨 Please review the guidelines for contributing to this repository: https://github.com/wp-graphql/wp-graphql/blob/develop/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

- [ ] Make sure your PR title follows Conventional Commit standards. See: https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/#specification . Allowed prefixes: `build`, `chore`, `ci`, `docs`, `feat`, `fix`, `perf`, `refactor`, `revert`, `style`, `test`
- [ ] Make sure you are making a pull request against the **develop branch** (left side). Also you should start *your branch* off *our master*.
- [ ] Make sure you are requesting to pull request from a **topic/feature/bugfix branch** (right side). Don't pull request from your master!

-->

What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
---------------------------------------------------
This is mainly stabilizing the term cursor when there are more than one term have the same term name.

Does this close any currently open issues?
------------------------------------------
<!--
### Write "closes #{pr number}"
### see: https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue#linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue-using-a-keyword
-->
relates to #2926 but it doesn't close it because there are 2 failed tests after applying the changes:

```
---------
1) MenuConnectionQueriesTest: Query with first and last
 Test  tests/wpunit/MenuConnectionQueriesTest.php:testQueryWithFirstAndLast
Failed asserting that two arrays are identical.
- Expected | + Actual
@@ @@
Array &0 (
-    'databaseId' => 153
+    'databaseId' => 155
)
#1  /var/www/html/wp-content/plugins/wp-graphql/tests/wpunit/MenuConnectionQueriesTest.php:354
#2  /var/www/html/wp-content/plugins/wp-graphql/vendor/bin/codecept:120

---------
2) TermObjectConnectionQueriesTest: Query with first and last
 Test  tests/wpunit/TermObjectConnectionQueriesTest.php:testQueryWithFirstAndLast
Failed asserting that two arrays are identical.
- Expected | + Actual
@@ @@
Array &0 (
-    'databaseId' => 299
+    'databaseId' => 301
)
#1  /var/www/html/wp-content/plugins/wp-graphql/tests/wpunit/TermObjectConnectionQueriesTest.php:332
#2  /var/www/html/wp-content/plugins/wp-graphql/vendor/bin/codecept:120
```



Any relevant logs, error output, GraphiQL screenshots, etc?
-------------------------------------
<!-- (If it’s long, please paste to https://ghostbin.com/ and insert the link here.) -->

The reproduction and any related logs, sql queries are mentioned in the related issue description.


Any other comments?
-------------------
…


Where has this been tested?
---------------------------
**Operating System:** Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS

**WordPress Version:** 6.3.1

comment.body:
@mohjak I pushed some commits to fix a broken test unrelated to this feature (the akismet plugin had a name change that was causing some plugin query tests to fail)

If you could confirm that this fixes the issue(s) you were running into, that would be great 🙏🏻

comment.body:
@mohjak I pulled down your branch to see if I could diagnose why the 2 tests are failing. 

It seems that [this change](https://github.com/wp-graphql/wp-graphql/pull/2930/commits/4e6323a3038dc23d9949af7a6fc6330bb2d5c17b#diff-cd0eb2ae6ce272df1e4488c500b6900c0314dc2c0e5faa83fbde1ff35677a11eL106-L115) is causing the tests to fail. 

I [added it back](https://github.com/wp-graphql/wp-graphql/pull/2930/commits/06653f581c443376c2dc458fe54930ef8917ba05#diff-cd0eb2ae6ce272df1e4488c500b6900c0314dc2c0e5faa83fbde1ff35677a11eR106-R115) and the tests pass. 

----

Below is an overview of the behavior I'm experiencing now.

Similar to your scenario, I've created a category with several child categories, and I've given all the children the same name "Child 1"

![CleanShot 2023-10-25 at 10 08 32](https://github.com/wp-graphql/wp-graphql/assets/1260765/c56833ed-e553-4936-815f-c14525af9b41)

### BEFORE:

Query for the first 3 categories that are children of `category:70` (works roughly as expected. . .I get 3 of the child categories of `category:70`)

![CleanShot 2023-10-25 at 10 13 51](https://github.com/wp-graphql/wp-graphql/assets/1260765/8dafc1a9-dbb0-4043-a8c9-720df182d26f)

Use the cursor for `category:77` as the value for the `after` cursor. 

**Expectation:** see 3 more categories that are children of `category:70`

**Actual:** No results:

![CleanShot 2023-10-25 at 10 17 12](https://github.com/wp-graphql/wp-graphql/assets/1260765/92b81a84-1bf7-4126-922d-d96cbea306f1)


### AFTER:

Now, with this PR (your changes + my change to add back the previously removed code)...

Query for the first 3 categories that are children of `category:70` (I get 3 of the child categories of `category:70`)

![CleanShot 2023-10-25 at 10 18 26](https://github.com/wp-graphql/wp-graphql/assets/1260765/3d516bd7-6863-4019-b343-46d5073a493b)

Now, we can take the cursor for `category:80` and use it as the `after` cursor:

**Expectation:** See categories `79`, `78`, `77`

**Actual:** see categories `79`, `78`, `77` ✅

![CleanShot 2023-10-25 at 10 20 29](https://github.com/wp-graphql/wp-graphql/assets/1260765/61419154-d297-49f1-b9ad-597e7daf2f5f)

issue.title: fix: fallback to template filename if sanitized name is empty

labels.name: status: in review
labels.description: Needs to be reviewed by a project maintainer before merge

labels.name: scope: i18n
labels.description: Affects usage in non-English language contexts.

issue.body:
<!--

### Your checklist for this pull request
Thanks for sending a pull request! Please make sure you click the link above to view the contribution guidelines, then fill out the blanks below.

🚨 Please review the [guidelines for contributing](/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this repository.

- [x] Make sure your PR title follows Conventional Commit standards. See: [https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/#specification](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/#specification)
- [x] Make sure you are making a pull request against the **develop branch** (left side). Also you should start *your branch* off *our master*.
- [x] Make sure you are requesting to pull request from a **topic/feature/bugfix branch** (right side). Don't pull request from your master!

-->

What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
---------------------------------------------------
When we use non-ascii characters in all of template name, non-ascii characters type generated.

This PR is fix the issue by using file name.

Does this close any currently open issues?
------------------------------------------
fixes #2807, fixes #2492

Any relevant logs, error output, GraphiQL screenshots, etc?
-------------------------------------
(If it’s long, please paste to https://ghostbin.com/ and insert the link here.)


Any other comments?
-------------------
…


Where has this been tested?
---------------------------
**Operating System:** docker

**WordPress Version:** 6.2

comment.body:
@imjlk can you open another issue with steps to reproduce? If there's still a bug with locales, we should track it and work toward a fix (or at least document it)

I'd love to know more about what you're experiencing and how to reproduce consistently

comment.body:
Well, the issue is definitely fixed for WordPress site using the GraphiQL IDE, but when working with the integration using various GraphQL clients(in my case, graphql-codegen features), I still encounter issues when the site locale is in non-ASCII format.
People can find the issue(#2492) and know about it, but wouldn't it be nice if there was a mention of it in the official docs?

issue.title: Idea: SemVer auto-update enforcement

labels.name: status: :rocket: actionable
labels.description: Issues that have been curated, have enough info to take action, and are ready to be worked on

issue.body:
### What problem does this address?

WordPress loves auto-updates; Headless apps that rely on a strongly-typed schema, not so much.
As we get closer to closing out the non-breaking backlog and start on a v2.0, we should consider a way to enforce SemVer on the WP backend.

### What is your proposed solution?

At a bare minimum, we should disable automatic updates for **X**.y.z releases, and place some sort of notice/confirmation dialog when trying to update the plugin manually to a major version in the background.

Ideally, we would take this a step further, and let users (either by filter or by admin setting) set a different autoupdate policy (E.g. only autoupdate x.y.**Z** versions).

As a bonus, we could even let users opt-in to a beta/next channel, as (based on the gh issue tracker), there's a lot of fundamental/breaking work we have slated for v2.

Major stretch goal would be to allow WPGraphQL extensions to provide a `tested up to` label, so we could also warn about possible incompatibilities with a new major release.

I would recommend implementing this _well before_ we start work on v2, so there can be a series of releases to ensure there's no kinks before game-day.

### What alternatives have you considered?

_No response_

### Additional Context

- The [`auto_update_{type}` hook](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/classes/wp_automatic_updater/should_update/#hooks)
- WC's [Plugin Update logic](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/tree/2343d5201af878a394b800a5664adeb82c37bae7/plugins/woocommerce/includes/admin/plugin-updates) (used to display update warnings based on versions and tested compatibility.
- WC's [Beta Channel logic](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/blob/trunk/plugins/woocommerce-beta-tester/includes/class-wc-beta-tester.php)

comment.body: @jasonbahl @justlevine Last night I updated my semantic versioning plugin to be a standalone class instead that you can install via Composer. Here's more info: https://github.com/blakewilson/wp-enforce-semver#usage

issue.title: Implicit excerpt from content should be an option and not mandatory

labels.name: status: discussion
labels.description: Requires a discussion to proceed

issue.body:
When querying for an excerpt in a post and the post has not explicitly defined an excerpt, at the moment, the excerpt gets created from the content.

That's a problem, because if in the frontend, I want to only show an excerpt if it is defined, I can't. It will always contain content with the current implementation.

Three options, how it could be handled come into my mind:

1. There is a flag, like `excerptExists`.
2. There is a format option like excerpt(format: "fromContent") or something similar. Default should be null if not defined.
3. There are 2 fields: `excerpt` and `excerptContent` or `contentExcerpt`


I personally lean to option 3 or 2.

comment.body:
Came here to post exactly this idea and found this existing issue.

I think there should be a way to either disable automatic excerpts, or have a flag so that I can easily decide in code on whether to render the excerpt I got.

pull_request.body:
Bumps [@babel/traverse](https://github.com/babel/babel/tree/HEAD/packages/babel-traverse) from 7.17.3 to 7.23.2.
Release notes

Sourced from @​babel/traverse's releases.

v7.23.2 (2023-10-11)

NOTE: This release also re-publishes @babel/core, even if it does not appear in the linked release commit.

Thanks @​jimmydief for your first PR!

:bug: Bug Fix

  • babel-traverse
    • #16033 Only evaluate own String/Number/Math methods (@​nicolo-ribaudo)
  • babel-preset-typescript
    • #16022 Rewrite .tsx extension when using rewriteImportExtensions (@​jimmydief)
  • babel-helpers
    • #16017 Fix: fallback to typeof when toString is applied to incompatible object (@​JLHwung)
  • babel-helpers, babel-plugin-transform-modules-commonjs, babel-runtime-corejs2, babel-runtime-corejs3, babel-runtime
    • #16025 Avoid override mistake in namespace imports (@​nicolo-ribaudo)

  • Babel Bot (@​babel-bot)
  • Huáng Jùnliàng (@​JLHwung)
  • James Diefenderfer (@​jimmydief)
  • Nicolò Ribaudo (@​nicolo-ribaudo)
  • @​liuxingbaoyu

Re-publishing @babel/helpers due to a publishing error in 7.23.0.

issue.body:
Bumps [@babel/traverse](https://github.com/babel/babel/tree/HEAD/packages/babel-traverse) from 7.17.3 to 7.23.2.
Release notes

Sourced from @​babel/traverse's releases.

v7.23.2 (2023-10-11)

NOTE: This release also re-publishes @babel/core, even if it does not appear in the linked release commit.

Thanks @​jimmydief for your first PR!

:bug: Bug Fix

  • babel-traverse
    • #16033 Only evaluate own String/Number/Math methods (@​nicolo-ribaudo)
  • babel-preset-typescript
    • #16022 Rewrite .tsx extension when using rewriteImportExtensions (@​jimmydief)
  • babel-helpers
    • #16017 Fix: fallback to typeof when toString is applied to incompatible object (@​JLHwung)
  • babel-helpers, babel-plugin-transform-modules-commonjs, babel-runtime-corejs2, babel-runtime-corejs3, babel-runtime
    • #16025 Avoid override mistake in namespace imports (@​nicolo-ribaudo)

labels.name: scope: dependencies
labels.description: Affects project dependencies such as Composer/NPM packages

labels.name: javascript
labels.description: Pull requests that update Javascript code

issue.title: Querying for preview via asPreview argument doesn't work when querying by slug, uri idTypes

labels.name: status: :rocket: actionable
labels.description: Issues that have been curated, have enough info to take action, and are ready to be worked on

labels.name: ObjectType: Post
labels.description: Issues related to the Post object type in WP

issue.body:
According to the switch statement at https://github.com/wp-graphql/wp-graphql/blob/develop/src/Type/Object/RootQuery.php#L503, when querying a post preview via slug or uri, the resolver functions return early before checking the `asPreview` parameter and returning the revision. 

This seems like it would be considered a bug because I would expect the same behavior regardless of which IdType is being used, also because I don't see any documentation that specifically explains why this would be intentional.

commits.message: Created `resolve_node_preview` to make things more DRY
Removing the union type as this was introduced in PHP 8.2 and the current required PHP version is 7.1
Add preview support for Post Type with ID Type `slug` or `uri`
Remove slug from preview content node tests
Add preview URI content node tests
Add preview tests for URI and SLUG ID types
make idType a variable in tests
Use 1 query in tests with idType variable

pull_request.title: fix: Support asPreview by URI/SLUG Id Type
pull_request.body: What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes. --------------------------------------------------- This PR fixes previews when querying by `URI` ID Type in a `ContentNode` with `AsPreview` set to `true` or by a post type (eg. `post`, `page`) with `asPreview` set to `true` and with ID Types of `URI` or `SLUG`. The following queries can be used for testing: ```graphql query GetPreview($slug: ID!, $asPreview: Boolean!) { post(id: $slug, idType: SLUG, asPreview: $asPreview) { ... on NodeWithTitle { title } ... on NodeWithContentEditor { content } date } } ``` ```graphql query GetPreview($uri: ID!, $asPreview: Boolean!) { contentNode(id: $uri, idType: URI, asPreview: $asPreview) { ... on NodeWithTitle { title } ... on NodeWithContentEditor { content } date } } ``` Does this close any currently open issues? ------------------------------------------ Closes #1673 Any relevant logs, error output, GraphiQL screenshots, etc? ------------------------------------- `contentNode` test with `asPreview` set to `false` `contentNode` test with `asPreview` set to `true` `post` test using `URI` for ID Type with `asPreview` set to `false` `post` test using `URI` for ID Type with `asPreview` set to `true` `post` test using `SLUG` for ID Type with `asPreview` set to `false` `post` test using `SLUG` for ID Type with `asPreview` set to `true` Any other comments? ------------------- … Where has this been tested? --------------------------- **Operating System:** MacOS 13.1 **WordPress Version:** 6.3.1 **WPGraphQL Version:** 1.16.0

labels.name: status: awaiting author response
labels.description: Additional information has been requested from the author

issue.title: Sticky posts are ignored
issue.body:
### Description

When I mark a post as sticky, it is not output first in the query.

I read in another [issue ](https://github.com/wp-graphql/wp-graphql/issues/786) that by default `$query_args['ignore_sticky_posts']` is set to `true`.

https://github.com/wp-graphql/wp-graphql/blob/develop/src/Data/Connection/PostObjectConnectionResolver.php#L178

 I have disabled this:

```
add_filter('graphql_post_object_connection_query_args', function($query_args, $source, $input) {
    $query_args['ignore_sticky_posts'] = false;
    return $query_args;
}, 10, 3);
```

Unfortunately this did not change anything.

### Steps to reproduce

1. mark a post as sticky.
2. Output a query with posts.
3. The sticky post is not output at the top.

### Additional context

_No response_

### WPGraphQL Version

0.12.2

### WordPress Version

6.3.2

### PHP Version

8.1

### Additional environment details

_No response_

### Please confirm that you have searched existing issues in the repo.

- [X] Yes

### Please confirm that you have disabled ALL plugins except for WPGraphQL.

- [X] Yes
- [ ] My issue is with compatibility with a specific WordPress plugin, and I have listed all my installed plugins (and version info) above.

comment.body: I saw that, but there doesn't seem to be a solution currently.

issue.title: Unable to query menuItems from "UTILITY" menu location with Apollo (works in GraphiQL)

labels.name: status: awaiting author response
labels.description: Additional information has been requested from the author

issue.body: ### Description Added Utility menu to Utility menu location I have this menu location returning menu items here However this query isn't working in my NextJS header ### Steps to reproduce 1. Added Utility menu to Utility menu location 2. Query menuItems where location: UTILITY ### Additional context I feel like I'm missing something obvious here since it works in the GraphiQL IDE... but I've searched and can't find anything so here we are. ### WPGraphQL Version 1.17.0 ### WordPress Version 6.3.0 ### PHP Version 8.0 ### Additional environment details ### Please confirm that you have searched existing issues in the repo. - [X] Yes ### Please confirm that you have disabled ALL plugins except for WPGraphQL. - [ ] Yes - [ ] My issue is with compatibility with a specific WordPress plugin, and I have listed all my installed plugins (and version info) above.

comment.body: @blakewilson yep, I did run after creating "Utility" and it didn't fail but also didn't seem to fix the issue. I ran it again after creating the "HeaderTop" menu as well and then it worked.
